Package game

Class PlayerShip

java.lang.Object
game.PlayerShip
All Implemented Interfaces:
Element, KeyListener, EventListener
public class PlayerShip extends Object implements KeyListener, Element
PlayerShip class handles the ship object that the player controls, where health points, movement and shooting mechanics are implemented here. This class extends the Polygon class and implements the Element and keyListener interface, allowing it to be rendered and interacted within the game.
Author:
Tong Zhan, Hayden Wong

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerShip

      public PlayerShip(Point[] inShape, Point inPosition, double inRotation)
      Initial Constructor for the PlayerShip Class. Coordinates are handled through the Polygon class.
      Parameters:
      inShape - Coordinates of the Ship object when drawn.
      inPosition - Position of the Ship Object. Center of the screen as a default.
      inRotation - Degree of the Ship Object when it is rotating. Not used.

    • PlayerShip

      public PlayerShip()
      Default constructor for the PlayerShip Class.

      Specified by:

    • move

      public void move()
      Process Method for moving the object when the movement keys are pressed. Default movement range is five pixels.

    • keyTyped

      public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e)
      Not needed since no direct keyboard input is needed in this game except movement keys, which are handled by the keyPressed method.
      Specified by:
      keyTyped in interface KeyListener

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
      When a dedicated key for movement is pressed, the KeyEvent handler catches the input and moves the object.
      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - registers the key strokes of the user

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e)
      When a dedicated key for movement is released from being pressed, the KeyEvent handler catches the input and stops moving the object.
      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - registers the key strokes of the user

    • collides

      public boolean collides(ArrayList<Bullets> bullets)
      Collision handler for Player's ship. Searches through the Bullet ArrayList for any instance of bullet having the same coordinates as the Player's ship, and returns true if conditions are met, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      bullets - Takes in an ArrayList of Bullets and searches it for any instances of the Bullet object having the same coordinates as the Player's ship.
      Returns:
      true if Player's ship collides with bullets of the Aliens, false otherwise.

    • isMoveLeft

      public boolean isMoveLeft()
      return method for moveLeft
      Returns:
      true if playerShip movedLeft, false otherWise.

    • isMoveRight

      public boolean isMoveRight()
      return method for moveRight
      Returns:
      true if playerShip moved right, false otherWise.

      public void resetBullets()
      Resets bullets by creating a new Bullet object.

    • getShot

      public boolean getShot()
      getter method for the shot boolean. This boolean checks whether or not the Player has fired a shot.
      Returns:
      true if shot, false otherwise.

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      getter method for the Player's current ship health.
      Returns:
      integer value of the health points the Player current has.

    • getMaxHealth

      public int getMaxHealth()
      getter method for the Player's max ship health.
      Returns:
      integer value of the most health points the Player can have. 100 by default.

    • resetHealth

      public void resetHealth()
      resets the health of the Player's ship by setting it to the max health value.

      ammo count value in type integer.

      Returns:
      max ammo count value in type integer. 100 by default.

      setter method for the Player's ship's ammo count to max ammo value.

    • setShot

      public void setShot(boolean shot)
      this method determines whether or not the ship has shot and sets it to the current shot variable.
      Parameters:
      shot - true if ship has shot a bullet, false otherwise.

    • setStepSize

      public void setStepSize(int stepSize)
      this method takes in a new stepSize, or ship speed value, and sets it to the current speed value.
      Parameters:
      stepSize - new ship speed.

    • toggleBlinking

      public void toggleBlinking()
      this method toggles the blinking effect of the Player ship by turning the isBlinking variable to false/true when called, and initiates the blink delay time.

    • deductHealth

      public void deductHealth(int amount)
      deducts the Player ship health by the new amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of health deducted once the ship collides with a bullet.

    • collides

      public boolean collides(game.Polygon other)
      Checks if the current polygon collides with another polygon. * * This method determines whether any point of the current polygon lies within the boundaries of the specified polygon 'other', indicating a collision between the two polygons.
      Parameters:
      other - The polygon with which collision detection is being performed.
      Returns:
      true if a collision is detected, false otherwise.
